## About Me

Samuel Blay Nguah is a paediatrician and medical statistician based in Kumasi, the second-largest city in Ghana. He is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Child Health of the School of Medicine and Dentistry, Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology.

He has been practising as a Medical Doctor at the Komfo Anokye Teaching Hospital since the year 2000 and as a paediatrician since the year 2005. He has a special interest in Paediatric Cardiology and has been caring for children with both congenital and acquired heart diseases since 2007.

He takes delight in teaching, hence his appointment at the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology as a lecturer in 2016.

As a medical statistician, he has actively taken part in many surveys and research, with well over 50 publications in peer-reviewed medical journals. He is an ardent user of the R software for data analysis and visualization. He frequently gives talks to resident doctors in training on topics, including research methods and biostatistics.

His hobbies include reading, swimming and gardening.
